intro: Schnella excisa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often arranged in a tight, cylindrical cluster. Its flowering spikes produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or brown in color. Schnella excisa plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
